channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Sabina Nessa: Murder suspect questioned over teacher death
item.description: A 38-year-old is arrested and police release an image of a second man they are searching for.

item.title: Ingoldmells caravan fire: Inquest into toddler death opens
item.description: Louisiana-Brooke Dolan is thought to have died from the effects of smoke inhalation, an inquest hears.

item.title: Port of Dover: Arrests made as Insulate Britain blocks port
item.description: Queues form at Europe's busiest ferry terminal as Insulate Britain shift their protest from the M25.

item.title: HS2 not ready before 2041, MP Andrew Bridgen claims in Commons
item.description: Backbencher Andrew Bridgen says a whistleblower predicts the project will be delayed by a decade.

item.title: Killamarsh: Man in crown court charged with murders of children and woman
item.description: Damien Bendall is accused of killing Terri Harris and three children at a house in Derbyshire.

item.title: Birmingham hospital worker stole QE patient's bank cards
item.description: Hospital worker Rebecca Ellis also goes on a Dorothy Perkins spending spree using the dying man's funds.

item.title: Mondelez threatens trademark battle over bar's lilac packaging
item.description: Mondelez believes Primal Pantry's vegan fruit bar "exploits" the trademark of its Milka chocolates.

item.title: Vicky Glass murder: Police to reinvestigate 21-year-old case
item.description: Vicky Glass's body was found six weeks after she disappeared in 2000, but no-one has been caught.

item.title: Burnley man denies Marks & Spencer terror attack murder attempt
item.description: A Burnley man tells a court he "did not attempt to murder" two women in a Marks & Spencer store.

item.title: Seven out of 10 win benefits challenges at tribunal
item.description: More than 287,000 people in three years overturn initial government decision.

item.title: Freshers Week: Organised criminals targeting universities
item.description: A drugs charity boss said the best safety advice was not to take the drugs in the first place.

item.title: Sickle cell disease: Patient's 'excruciating' wait for pain drugs
item.description: John Griffiths says hospital staff in Kent routinely fail to provide the medication he needs.

item.title: Homeless in London: 'People pretend they are not there'
item.description: Photographer Anthony Dawton has been documenting London's homeless population during the pandemic.

item.title: Social prescribing: How a community garden helps combat isolation
item.description: Sara Lee says she has "come out of her shell" after being referred to Blackpool Community Farm.

item.title: The Cumbrian walking group going strong after 20 years
item.description: The weekly group in Cumbria was set up in 1998 for former bank colleagues to stay in contact.

item.title: Teenager in Peterborough e-scooter near-miss with bus
item.description: The 16-year-old is sentenced after CCTV sees him almost colliding with the vehicle in Peterborough.

item.title: Virtual reality helps Stafford cancer patients
item.description: From Phuket to the Peak District - cancer patients visit sun-kissed beaches without leaving hospice.

item.title: Corrie Mckeague: Credible leads needed in RAF airman probe - police
item.description: A body has never been found since Corrie Mckeague disappeared on a night out five years ago.

item.title: New Zealand 45-49 England: Roses fight back to win in New Zealand for first time
item.description: England claim a first ever series win in New Zealand as a final-quarter fightback helps them beat the world champions 49-45 in Christchurch.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Heather Knight inspires hosts to ODI series victory
item.description: Heather Knight leads England to their highest successful run chase in a ODI as they beat New Zealand by three wickets to clinch the five-match series.

item.title: County Championship: Dramatic Lancashire victory ends Hampshire title hopes
item.description: Lancashire will become champions if Warwickshire fail to beat Somerset after a one-wicket win over Hampshire at Aigburth.
